abstract.p: Editors' note on Sept 16 article on life of textile workers in Nicaragua

block.p: An article on Saturday described the life of textile workers in Nicaragua. It quoted Charles Kernaghan, executive director of the National Labor Committee, an international group that is trying to organize the workers for better wages and conditions. The article was illustrated with a photograph of dozens of women walking across a field, presumably on the way to work at a Nicaraguan textile plant. The credit line attributed the picture to Mr. Kernaghan.

With an article about a labor-management conflict, The Times should have relied on an impartial source for photographs; failing that, the caption should have specified that the source was an interested party.
